bibl.title: James McGarth and William Herbert v. King County. Letter from Greene.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: These men seem to be held for the crime of passing counterfit coin of the United States, with intention contrary to the status of the United States. The off at upon which the justice committed them, charges no specific acts consituting the crime, altles' in pennal terms it charges the crime there is, this, a defect in, "the charge", within statute 616 if one testimonial criminal code.

Section 1014 of the UL Reacted States provided that on offends against ie .s. Criminal Statutes may be arrested. imprisioned or bailed as nearby to the unusual mode of process of aganist affluences in any he may be found. The word "state" here is generic + includes a territory, as well as a state, of the union. The plural mode of process means mode of procedure. A post of the mode of the procedure in the territory for arresting, imprisoning or bailing deffendants or: gainst its laws, where the charge before the justice is defective, is the inventification upon writ of habeas corpus under section 616 of the statute of 1873, page 162.

Let the prosecuting witnesses herein be summoned to appear before me on Wednesday, the 24th day of March instant at 10 o'clock a.m. + let the further hearing hereof be adjourned title been + maintained let the N.S. near shall have custody of realtors until my further word
div1.ab: Filed March 22 1880 James Seavey, Clerk. By James P. Ludlow Deputy Clerk.
